column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Kokesh at an anti-war rally in 2007 Image : Sage Ross .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Which historical or contemporary figures do you admire and consider as role models ? Why ?
#Text=Kokesh : I do n't believe in having role models because it can limit you in your own self-actualization .

#Text=This might sound semantic , but it 's a meaningful difference to me to have teachers instead of role models so we can get useful lessons and inspiration from many people and still be ourselves .
#Text=I admire a lot of people for a lot of different things and learn from everyone I can .

#Text=Right now , I think about how I learned to distrust authority from my parents , courage from people like Ross Ulbricht , Ed Snowden , Chelsea Manning , and Julian Assange , patience from people like Ron Paul , intellectual persistence from people like Murray Rothbard , and compassion from people like my girlfriend .
#Text=( ( WN ) )
#Text=At what point during your time in Iraq did you realize the effort there was immoral ?
#Text=Kokesh : While I was in Iraq , I did n't have the presence of mind or the awareness to come to the conclusion that it was immoral .
#Text=I identified as a " Libertarian " at the time , but I can look back now and see that I was really an arrogant militant minarchist with poorly thought out libertarian principles .
#Text=I was against the invasion of Iraq before it happened as a matter of policy more than principle .
#Text=I supported the ongoing occupation because I thought of it as cleaning up our mess .
#Text=It was n't until I came home and got out of the Marines that I was able to get the right moral perspective .
#Text=( ( WN ) )
#Text=In what ways do you believe you have accomplished what you have sought through activism ?
#Text=In what ways have you failed ?
#Text=Kokesh : I define an activist as anyone whose work is primarily motivated by a deep-seated sense of injustice .
#Text=In that sense , most of us have some ideology or global vision for justice in mind , some unachievable ideal .
#Text=Short of that , I have a realistic ideal that the Libertarian Party defines as , " a world set free in our lifetime .

#Text= To me that means a voluntary society , not one that is perfectly voluntary in every interaction , but that recognizes the ideal of voluntaryism and in which there is no institutional coercion .
